text:
Ro: Hey guys, it’s Ro, welcome to another
Nerdy Nummies!

Ro: Today I have a special guest, Kurt! Kurt:
What’s up guys!?!?

Ro: My good friend, he came back again because
he was so handsome.

Ro: Set your phasers to stunning! Because
today we are gonna be making

Ro: Star Trek Insignia cookies! We got so
many requests for these,

Ro: I hope you guys like ‘em. And I will
put Kurt’s links down below,

Ro: so you can go check out his channel. He
makes awesome music!

Kurt: I’m not very good at baking though,
so… Ro: That’s OK!
Kurt: I gotta rely on her for this 1.

Ro: I’ll help you out, I’m wearing my
yellow shirt today, my commander

Ro: color shirt. Uh, Kurt’s wearing the
red shirt, so, we know what that means.

Ro: Alright, let’s get started! Kurt: Let’s
do it!

Ro: The things you will need, will be: Regular
flour, regular sugar,

Ro: 3 jams, we have strawberry, lemon, it’s
actually lemon curd, and

Ro: blueberry jam, 1 egg, 2 sh-ticks of butter,
each a 1/2 cup so in total,

Ro: a cup. circular cookie cutter, vanilla
extract, salt, and…

Kurt: You’ll also need an orange, a zester,
which I just found out the name

Kurt: of, big bowl to mix your stuff in, and
a blender.
Ro: Yeah! Let’s put it all together.

Ro: OK, this is a really cool recipe, I found
it online, on a site called

Ro: KitchenOverlord.com, so I’m taking the
recipe and kind of changing it a

Ro: little bit, but it was so good I was like,
we have to make these for

Ro: ourselves! OK, so Kurt is gonna start
by taking the 2 sticks of

Ro: butter, unwrapping them and putting them
in the bowl.
Kurt: I think I got this!

Ro: Yep, and then you’re gonna add your
2/3 cup of sugar, and beat them

Ro: together. And while you’re doing that
I’m going to zest the orange.

Ro: So you just take your zester. Kurt: She
gets the fun part…

Ro: Yeah, I just do it like this, it’s kind
of like grating cheese.
Ro: Just push it against.

Ro: And we just need 1 teaspoon, so you don’t
need a lot.

Ro: Look at that, it smells so good, like
fresh orange!

Ro: Can you smell that? Kurt: Smells really
good, yeah.
Ro: Oh it smells so good!
Kurt: I’m all ready for the mixing.

Ro: Alright, so you just whip these together
until it’s all consistent.
Ro: You can do it!

Ro: You did so good, I’m gonna promote you!
Look at that! Boom!
Ro: Commander Kurt!

Ro: Da-da! Once you’ve creamed together
your butter and sugar, you are

Ro: gonna add the other ingredients. OK, 1
egg, I’m gonna leave it up to you.

Kurt: OK, this wasn’t a great idea for you
to leave it up to me last time.

Ro: Last time, it was a bad idea. So, of course
I’m gonna do it again.

Kurt: Wow, that worked much better! Ro: That
was better!

Ro: I’ll take this, and then if you’ll
take 1 teaspoon of the orange.

Kurt: Of zest? Ro: Yeah, orange-y zest. And
then you do 1 teaspoon of
Ro: vanilla extract.

Ro: You’re supposed to take a pinch of salt,
I have a really small pinch

Ro: because I have really small hands, so
I’m gonna let you do it. Take
Ro: a big pinch of salt. Kurt: A big pinch.

Ro: Yeah a big pinch, throw it in there! Boom!
Now you’re gonna blend that
Ro: together until everything is consistent.

Kurt: Love this part! Ro: Pew-pew, pew-pew! Kurt:
Should we do it?
Ro: It looks like a laser gun!

Ro: Once you’ve blended all of those together,
it looks so good!

Ro: It smells delicious, look at it you can
see the little orange,

Ro: orange zests in there! Kurt: It’s gonna
be pretty good! Ro: Yum-yum-yum!

Ro: Now you’re gonna add 2 cups of flour.
this is the last step.

Ro: Doo-doo-doo-doo-doo! OK, and then mix
1 more time until everything

Ro: is combined… Evenly! Kurt: Putting me
to work with this blender.
Ro: Yeah, I really am!
Ro: Oh, oh, oh, oh!
Kurt: Almost sneezed, but I didn’t.
Ro: It’s OK, it’s OK!

Ro: Here’s our dough, it’s all ready,
now what you’re gonna want to do is

Ro: have a little bit of extra flour, because
if it’s a little bit too

Ro: sticky, you’ll just sprinkle in a little
bit more, and if it’s too

Ro: dry just add a little bit of water. It
just kind of depends.

Ro: But what we’re gonna do is, we’re
gonna put our hands in there!

Kurt: Awesome, I’ve been waiting for this
part. Ro: Yeah, oh, and see…

Ro: This is a little bit, a little bit too
sticky, just a little bit.
Ro: So I am gonna put some flour, just a sprinkle.
Ro: Just a little sprinkle! There we go.

Ro: And now, I’ll let you grab 1/2 of it.
Kurt: Alright!

Ro: And then you can put it on the table,
sprinkle it.

Ro: And here we’re just gonna roll the dough,
into a ball, and if it’s

Ro: sticking to you like that, do you need
flour? Kurt: Um, sure.
Ro: Is it sticky?

Ro: Just keep rolling it into a ball, because
the more you play with dough
Ro: the firmer it gets.

Ro: OK, now we’re gonna combine our 2 dough
balls.

Ro: When our 2 dough balls combined! Kurt:
Schwaaaaa, bahhhhhh!
Ro: It’s beautiful, it looks like a planet.

Ro: OK, now you’re gonna wrap it up tightly
in saran wrap, and then

Ro: put it in the fridge for about an hour
to chill.

Ro: Beam it up, beam it up! Beam it up, beam
it up! Kurt: Beam it up!

Ro: Beam it up, beam it up! Kurt: Beam it
up! Ro: Beam up, beam up, beam up.
Ro: Scotty…

Ro: Once your cookie dough has chilled in the fridge,
you’re gonna take it out,
Ro: unwrap it. Oh!
Ro: Unwrap it again! We double wrapped it!
Ro: OK, I’m gonna break it in 1/2.

Kurt: Do you want help breaking it in 1/2?
Ro: Yeah, yeah. Kurt: Alright.

Ro: Commander Kurt is gonna break it in 1/2.
Kurt: Alright.

Ro: So that we can each work on 1. And it’s
just a little bit firm,

Ro: so you’re just gonna work it into the table
so that it becomes a little bit
Ro: softer, easier to work with. Eragh!
Ro: I need Klingon strength!
Ro: They’re just like…

Kurt: Are you OK? Ro: I just… Yeah, like,
my knuckle cracked!

Ro: Now you’re gonna take a little bit of
flour, toss it on the table.
Ro: Sprinkle, sprinkle, sprinkle!
Ro: Sprinkle, sprinkle, sprinkle!

Kurt: You have to make that sound, when you
do it!
Ro: Yeah, otherwise it doesn’t work!

Ro: Put your dough down, and you’re gonna
take a rolling pin, roll it flat,

Ro: and then we’re gonna cut out the circle
cookies.

Kurt: I’ve been waiting the entire shoot
to use this thing!

Ro: You have? Kurt: Yeah. Ro: Here, let me, let me
help out. Kurt: This is…
Ro: There you go, now you’re fancy.
Ro: And, yeah, put some muscle, that’s great!

Ro: Bonjour! Bonjour! Bonjour! Bonjour! Both:
Bonjour!

Ro: There goes the baker with his tray like
always!

Kurt: Now that you got all your dough rolled out,
you’re gonna use the cookie

Kurt: cutter, cut ‘em up and flipper them
on your little tray.

Ro: Once we got your cookies cut out,
we have all the circles

Ro: on the tray, you are gonna use your jams.
We have red yellow and

Ro: blueberry jam, and these are for the different
officers.

Ro: This is for the engineers, the yellow
will be for the commanders,

Ro: and the blueberry will be for, well it’s
medicine and science.

Kurt: Alright, we’re gonna start with our
red, our strawberry preserves.

Ro: Yum-yum-yum-yum-yum! And you can use any
red jam that you like, and then

Ro: you’re just gonna take a little teaspoon,
1 teaspoon, I know you’re gonna

Ro: want to put more, but don’t! Because
your jelly will bubble and over, overflow,
Ro: so just 1 teaspoon!

Ro: And so I scoop it, and then I take a little
toothpick, kinda mash it up,
Ro: then I take off the excess.

Ro: And then you’re gonna put it in the
middle of your cookie, right in

Ro: the middle, ah, ah, ah! And if it won’t
come out I like to use a little

Ro: paintbrush. You can also use a toothpick,
whatever you'd like.

Ro: Once you got all the jam on the cookies,
I’m gonna teach you how to

Ro: fold them to look like little insignias,
these are so cute!

Ro: Ok, so what you’re gonna do, first,
is at the top, make a pinch

Ro: right at the top. Kurt: Right. Ro: Pinch,
pinch, pinch.

Ro: And then you’re gonna fold up the bottom,
like a triangle,
Ro: and then pinch the sides.

Ro: And now, you’re gonna start at the top,
I hold it with my

Ro: 2 pointer fingers and I use my thumb and
I kind of hold it in place

Ro: like this. And I just press down a little
bit so that the top flattens.
Ro: Boop-boop-boop-boop-boop-boop-boop-boop!

Ro: So now you have the basic shape of the
triangle, now what you’re gonna do

Ro: is about 1/3 of the way, make an indent
right here.

Ro: And then bend ‘em down even further
so they really
Ro: get that shape that we want.

Ro: This is where you can use toothpicks to
kind of push in the dough,

Ro: use it as a flat edge, that’s really
helpful, ta-da, like so.

Ro: And then what I like to do is take this little
toothpick and push the

Ro: jelly really carefully, to the top and
spread it all over.

Ro: Because, when it’s in the oven the jelly
gets really hot, and it

Ro: basically boils, makes little bubbles,
and the thinner it is, if it’s

Ro: not just in 1 big clump, the more likely
it is the cookies will

Ro: come out perfect, first time, no problems.
Because it won’t spill over.

Kurt: Once you’re done shaping your cookies
and your oven is done preheating

Kurt: you’re gonna throw them in the oven
for about 6 minutes.

Ro: Yeah, until they’re like, lightly golden
brown. You'll know they’re good.
Both: Ta-da!

Ro: Here are our Star Trek Insignia cookies,
I hope that you guys liked them.

Ro: Thanks you guys for suggesting them, they
were so easy and fun to make!

Ro: Aw, we got our little red, and our yellow.
Kurt: And our blue!

Ro: Yeah, can’t forget about sick bay, can’t
forget about
Ro: the medicine officers!

Ro: Another thanks to my good friend Kurt
for being here, thank you for your

Ro: help. Kurt: Thank you for having me. Ro:
I love having Kurt on because

Ro: then I get to have help in the kitchen,
it’s so nice!

Kurt: Thank you, thank you, this was a ton
of fun. Ro: Yeah!

Ro: I will go put all of his links down below
so you can go check him out,

Ro: his YouTube and Twitter and Instagram
and all that fun stuff.

Ro: Also another thank you to Kitchen Overlord
for finding this recipe,

Ro: it was so cool, I’ll go put a link down
below so you guys can go check it

Ro: out! If you have any other ideas for any
other Nerdy Nummies, please

Ro: let me know, leave me a comment down below
and I will do my best to
Ro: make it happen!
Ro: OK, bye-bye!
Kurt: See ya guys!

Ro: Oh yeah, look a that, dew-dew! Kurt: How’s
it going commander?
Ro: Ah, things at the bridge look pretty good!
Ro: Kurt what does your shirt say?

Kurt: Well it’s a dinosaur saying… Ro:
Oh no! Kurt: All my friends are dead.

Ro: All my friends are dead… No they’re
not look, oh my gosh, you wore

Ro: the perfect shirt. Kurt: They’re right
here!

Ro: They’re right here! Hey bra, I been
here the whole time!
Kurt: We’ve been on the set of Nerdy Nummies.
Ro: You should have been kicking it with us!
